TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit RecipientInfo extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The RecipientInfo class represents information about a CMS/PKCS #7 message recipient. The RecipientInfo class is an abstract class inherited by the and classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is an abstract class that cannot be instantiated. It is inherited by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo> classes.

Docs.summary: The EncryptedKey abstract property retrieves the encrypted recipient keying material.
Docs.value: An array of byte values that contain the encrypted recipient keying material.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is an abstract property overridden by <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo>.

Docs.summary: The KeyEncryptionAlgorithm abstract property retrieves the algorithm used to perform the key establishment.
Docs.value: An object that contains the value of the algorithm used to establish the key between the originator and recipient of the CMS/PKCS #7 message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is an abstract property overridden by <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo>.

Docs.summary: The RecipientIdentifier abstract property retrieves the identifier of the recipient.
Docs.value: A object that contains the identifier of the recipient.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is an abstract property overridden by <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo>.

Docs.summary: The Type property retrieves the type of the recipient. The type of the recipient determines which of two major protocols is used to establish a key between the originator and the recipient of a CMS/PKCS #7 message.
Docs.value: A value of the enumeration that defines the type of the recipient.

Docs.summary: The Version abstract property retrieves the version of the recipient information. Derived classes automatically set this property for their objects, and the value indicates whether it is using PKCS #7 or Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) to protect messages. The version also implies whether the object establishes a cryptographic key by a key agreement algorithm or a key transport algorithm.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the version of the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is an abstract property overridden by <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyAgreeRecipientInfo> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo>.
The version determines whether the message is a PKCS #7 message or a CMS message. CMS is a newer superset of PKCS #7.
